command: $ErrorActionPreference='Stop'; $pscp='pscp.exe'; $log="$env:ProgramData\NetAdmin\logs\T1597.log"; $host='sftp.domaintools.com'; $user=$env:DT_USER; $key=$env:DT_PPK; $hostkey=$env:DT_HOSTKEY; $remote='/bulk/pdns/daily/pdns-2025-09-30.json.gz'; $dest='C:\Intel\DomainTools\pdns-2025-09-30.json.gz'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $dest) -Force | Out-Null; try { & $pscp -scp -batch -q -C -P 22 -i $key -hostkey $hostkey "$user@$host:$remote" "$dest"; if($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0){ throw "pscp exit code $LASTEXITCODE" }; $hash=(Get-FileHash -Algorithm SHA256 -Path $dest).Hash; $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; sha256=$hash; success=$true; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } catch { $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; success=$false; error=$_.Exception.Message; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } finally { $json=$status|ConvertTo-Json -Compress; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $log) -Force | Out-Null; Add-Content -Path $log -Value $json; Write-Output $json }
explanation: Acquires a commercial passive DNS daily export from DomainTools using SCP with host key pinning and logs a concise JSON result.
rationale_steps: Reach a closed-source DNS intelligence provider using SSH key auth and pinned host key.
Download a specific date-scoped dataset to minimize unnecessary transfers.
Compute a file hash and log structured metadata for validation and audit.
Stay within the scope of closed-source collection per T1597.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with proper variable declarations, error handling with try/catch/finally blocks, balanced quotes/braces, and correct command separators.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1597 (Search Closed Sources) by retrieving a commercial passive DNS dataset from DomainTools using secure SCP with proper authentication, error handling, and logging mechanisms.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, proper command execution, correct cmdlet usage, and a well-structured try/catch/finally block.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1597 by using `pscp` to acquire a commercial passive DNS export from a known intelligence provider (DomainTools), demonstrating a realistic acquisition from a closed source with appropriate authentication and logging.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell one-liner is well-formed with balanced quoting, valid PuTTY pscp flags, and correct separators.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It aligns with T1597 by fetching a paid DomainTools dataset via SCP and logging results, but attempts to assign to the read-only $host variable (likely causing immediate failure), targets a C:\ path that may require elevated rights, and forces SCP where the service may be SFTP-only, reducing operational plausibility.
